result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier Desun Taylor

records.addlTxt:
8:44 AM Defendant Xavier Desun Taylor appeared by video.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Xavier Desun Taylor.  Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Deft. by Zoom from GreenBay. Atty Preston indicatesThe defendant is reluctant to take the offer but does not want a jury trial set. Defendant speaks to the court and informs the court he has not spoken to his atty since August.  The court is going to set this over for a jury trial.  The State would ask to try 22CF321 set first.  Defendant makes statement to the court.  Defendant indicates he has ineffective assistance of counsel.  Defendant has just rec'd his discovery last month.  The court responds to the defendant.  Ineffective assistance of counsel is motioned for after trial.  The defendant asks to fire his counsel.  There is no other atty hired.  BTC: Atty and defendant to communicate.  The defendant asks atty Preston to file a motion to withdraw.  Court responds, defendant to
Jury trial scheduled for April 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for April 3, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 3, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on April 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.

9:04 AM . Defendant Xavier Desun Taylor in court, in custody. Atty Elizabeth Angove for Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Xavier Desun Taylor.  Attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense still needs to review the digital discovery on the second case with the defendant. Defense informs the court the defendant is in prison and this makes reviewing discovery difficult.  BTC: One last status given.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:29 am.

Defense asks that the defendant's appearance be excused or to appear by Zoom for the next hearing.  Deft. is in Dodge.

8:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Xavier Desun Taylor in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Xavier Desun Taylor. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Deft. appears via Zoom from Dodge Correctional.  State has tendered a global offer.  Defense needs more time to discuss the offer with the defendant.  Defense is unsure if all discovery has been sent to the defendant given his status at Dodge.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached AMENDED criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

8:58 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Xavier Desun Taylor. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Deft. has been transferred to Dodge Corr.  Defense has rec'd a global offer recently and needs to discuss it with the deft.

Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
